About Hartz:

We are motivated by our passion for pets. Hartz is a leading brand in pet care for over 95 years. That’s because we truly understand the bond between consumers and their pets, and strive to provide products that help give pets Unconditional Love.

What We Offer …

Competitive compensation and 401(k) match with immediate vesting
Comprehensive Health Insurance: Medical, Dental, Vision, FSA, Life & Disability Insurance
Generous PTO, Paid parental leave, tuition reimbursement, and other perks
Opportunity to learn and develop

The Role …

We seek an inquisitive and analytical candidate, passionate about crafting reports, extracting data, and providing valuable, actionable insights. In this role, you will analyze extensive datasets and business trends, provide these insights to both the local team and Customer while delivering presentations during line reviews and various business meetings.

Additionally, you will track the progress on goals against key strategies and recommend actions to achieve objectives. This position is located at our Bentonville, AR office. Local applicants are preferred for this position; no relocation reimbursement will be provided for applicants outside of the greater Bentonville area.

If this role interests you to work at Hartz, we encourage you to apply.

Your Responsibilities …

Create weekly, monthly scorecarding from multiple data sources (i.e. Circana/IRI, Luminate/ Retail Link)
Utilize available tools to consolidate and cleanse large data sets into easily digestible formats
Independently discern trends and provide insights-based recommendations to deliver sales objectives
Measure, interpret and draw conclusions with accuracy from sales and customer data
Craft impactful presentations with visually compelling, data-driven, actionable insights and strategies
Assist with customer, category business line review process and lead category presentations at assigned customers’ meetings
Proactively assess, signal and respond to any potential corporate and/or brand specific sales risks or opportunities
Evaluate the impact of pricing and track competitive activity to identify internal and external growth opportunities
Monitor new item performance and/or KPI’s as needed; this includes New Item, Promotional Events, and Seasonal Timing
Integrate Omni-channel insights into analysis where available
Maintain active item attribution and/or coding new items within Circana database

Requirements

You Need to Have …

Bachelor’s Degree in Business, Statistics, Computer Science, or related field with a minimum of 1 year of relevant CPG analytical experience manipulating and managing large amounts of data specifically for a Walmart Account, or;
Associate’s Degree in Business or Business Technology with a minimum of 3 years’ relevant experience for a Walmart Account
Proficiency in Retail Link/Luminate; ability to collect, organize, process and measure large amounts of Point of Sale (POS) data from Retail Link/Luminate
Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite programs and advanced level skillset in Excel (pivot tables, V-lookup, and advanced formulas)
Ability to measure, interpret and draw conclusions with accuracy from sales and customer data
Ability to craft impactful presentations to explain recommendations and findings of analyses, resources, and outside resource studies
Experience with Tableau, Power BI (or similar analytical packages) a plus
Experience with Circana/Nielson or Spins systems a plus
